responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: No Sanitization of User Input Before Use in NoSQL Query
    analysis: |
      The `readMany`, `count` and `listAndSort` functions in `MongoProviderImpl` construct MongoDB queries from unsanitized user input.  An attacker able to control any part of the input `BasicDBObject` could inject arbitrary MongoDB operators into the query.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names:
      - readMany
      - count
      - listAndSort
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/compatibilityaction/MongoProviderImpl.java
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: No Sanitization of User Input Before Use in NoSQL Query
leads.analysis: The readMany, count and listAndSort functions in MongoProviderImpl construct MongoDB queries from unsanitized user input.  An attacker able to control any part of the input BasicDBObject could inject arbitrary MongoDB operators into the query.
